headline: Paramount, Netflix, Comcast prep WBD bids: WSJ reports
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) stock climbs following reports from The Wall Street Journal that Paramount Skydance (PSKY), Netflix (NFLX), and Comcast (CMCSA) are preparing bids for the company. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal outlines what investors need to know. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of global entertainment and media company Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) jumped 3.5% in the morning session after reports indicated that several media giants, including Paramount, Comcast, and Netflix, were preparing bids to acquire the company.

headline: Stocks to Watch Friday: Applied Materials, Nvidia, Warner Bros.
summary: ↘️ Applied Materials (AMAT): The chip-equipment maker's quarterly results and forecasts for this quarter topped expectations, spurred by the AI boom. Shares skidded 5% in premarket trading, however, when a broader tech selloff looked poised to continue.

headline: WBD amends CEO Zaslav's contract, StubHub withholds Q4 guidance
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Merck (MRK) pursuing an acquisition of Cidara Therapeutics (CDTX) in a deal valued at $9.2 billion, the Wall Street Journal reporting that several media players are preparing bids on Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), and StubHub (STUB) shares plunging after withholding its fourth quarter guidance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Applied Materials, Nvidia, Walmart, Strategy, Warner Bros., and More
summary: The chip equipment maker reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue after Thursday’s close, andforecast solid results for the current quarter, which ends in January.  Walmart  declined 1.5% after the company announced longtime CEO Doug McMillan will retire next year.  John Furner, the current CEO of  Walmart  U.S., will succeed McMillon on Feb. 1, the company said.
